Arneodo Attractor

Attractor Builder (Blender add-on)
Equations:
dx/dt = y
dy/dt = z
dz/dt = -a*x - b*y + c*x**3
Parameters:
| a = -5.5 | b = 3.5 | c = -1 |
Simulation settings:
Initial state: x_0 = 0.1, y_0 = 0.0, z_0 = 0.0
Method: RK4
Time Step (dt): 0.015
Steps: 15000
Burn-in: 300
Scale: 0.1

Model details

This attractor shows a transition from periodic to chaotic behavior. Mathematically, it originates from a third-order system with a cubic term in x. Use this space for original formulas and narrative (you can use italic and bold).

References
Arneodo, A., Coullet, P., & Tresser, C. (1981).
A possible new mechanism for the onset of turbulence.
Physics Letters A, 81(4), 197–201.
DOI
